conbody.p: ContentMap shows document elements, structural nodes (entity and XInclude borders), processing instructions and comments, and also positions between them.

When you move the mouse pointer over ContentMap items, they get highlighted to better demonstrate the position in the document tree, and tooltips pop up showing attributes of elements and items' text.
You can move through a document in the ContentMap.

li.p: To move an item down/up the tree, press DownArrow/UpArrow.

note.p: When an element is highlighted in the ContentMap, to move the cursor to the same element in the Editing Window, press Enter or click the ContentMap element.

li.p: To move to the start/end of the current element, press Ctrl-Home/Ctrl-End.

In addition to its actual location, an element can occur in the document multiple times depending on the stylesheet and document view. For example, titles of Docbook sections can also be displayed in the Table of Contents at the beginning of the document or in grey draft areas.
To go through all occurrences of a particular element in the document, find the element in the ContentMap and keep clicking it.
To move a page up/down, press PageUp/PageDown.
To move to the start/end of the document, press Home/End.
To move to the parent of the current collapsed element or element without children, press LeftArrow.

note.p: If the current collapsed element is the first item and the horizontal scrollbar is offset to the right, the list view will be scrolled left.

li.p:
To move to the first child of the current expanded element, press RightArrow.
If the current element has no children, the list view will be scrolled right.
To collapse an expanded element, press LeftArrow.
To expand a collapsed element, press RightArrow.

note.p: When you navigate the ContentMap, the input focus is by default kept in it, and you can't enter text in the Editing Window. You can change the input focus between the ContentMap and the Editing Window.
